Shaboozey:
{{short description|American musician (born 1995)}} {{Use mdy dates|date=August 2024}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Shaboozey | image = | caption = | birth_name = Collins Obinna Chibueze | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1995|05|09}} | birth_place = [[Virginia]], U.S. | genre = {{hlist|[[Hip hop music|Hip hop]]|[[Alternative country|alt-country]]}} | occupation = {{hlist|Musician|rapper|singer|songwriter|filmmaker|record producer}} | instrument = Vocals | years_active = 2014–present | label = {{hlist|[[Republic Records|Republic]]|[[Empire Distribution|Empire]]}} | website = {{URL|americandogwood.com}} }} '''Collins Obinna Chibueze''' (born May 9, 1995), known professionally as '''Shaboozey''', is an American musician, singer, songwriter, filmmaker, and record producer.{{Cite web|url=https://www.allmusic.com/artist/shaboozey-mn0003690780|title=Shaboozey|first=Neil Z.|last=Yeung|publisher=[[AllMusic]]|access-date=April 2, 2024}}{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-country/beyonce-cowboy-carter-shaboozey-new-album-1234996467/|title=If You Liked Shaboozey on Beyoncé's 'Cowboy Carter,' You Can Hear His New Album Soon|date=March 29, 2024|first=Jon|last=Blistein|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|access-date=April 2, 2024}} He gained initial attention for his 2018 song "Start a Riot" (with [[Duckwrth]]), which was included on the [[Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse (soundtrack)|soundtrack]] to ''[[Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse]]''.{{Cite web|url=https://www.bet.com/article/v8qhqn/unboxed-shaboozey-remains-true-to-his-artistic-vision|title=#Unboxed Vol 30: Shaboozey Remains True To His Artistic Vision That Has No Limits|date=November 1, 2023|first=Rashad|last=Grove|publisher=[[BET]]|access-date=April 2, 2024}}{{Cite web|url=https://variety.com/2024/music/news/beyonce-cowboy-carter-breakdown-shaboozey-blackbird-cover-willie-jones-1235955386/|title=Beyoncé's 'Cowboy Carter': A Deep Dive Into the Featured Artists and Samples — From Shaboozey to 'These Boots Are Made for Walkin" and More|date=March 28, 2024|first=Steven J.|last=Horowitz|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|access-date=April 2, 2024}} In 2024, he collaborated with [[Beyoncé]] on two tracks from her eighth studio album, ''[[Cowboy Carter]]''. That same year, he released the country single "[[A Bar Song (Tipsy)]]", which peaked atop the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]]. ==Early life== Chibueze was born in northern [[Virginia]] to [[Nigerians|Nigerian]] parents and raised in [[Woodbridge, Virginia|Woodbridge]].{{Cite web|url=https://music.apple.com/us/artist/shaboozey/914125510|title=Shaboozey|publisher=[[Apple Music]]|access-date=April 2, 2024}} His stage name is derived from mispronunciations of his surname, meaning "God is king" in [[Igbo language|Igbo]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2024/03/29/arts/music/beyonce-cowboy-carter-credits.html|title=Who's Who on Beyoncé's 'Cowboy Carter'|date=March 29, 2024|first=Hank|last=Shteamer|work=[[The New York Times]]|access-date=April 2, 2024}} In his childhood, he was inspired by watching music videos on ''[[106 & Park]]'', as well as his time at a boarding school in Nigeria for junior high.{{Cite web |last=Lytras |first=Katerina |title=Virginia-based artist Shaboozey believes we can create whole universes in our minds |url=https://colorsxstudios.com/editorials/shaboozey-interview |access-date=April 2, 2024 |publisher=[[ColorsxStudios]]}} ==Career== In 2014, Shaboozey released his first single, "Jeff Gordon". That same year, he founded the [[production company]] V Picture Films.{{Cite web |last=Ortiz |first=Edwin |date=July 14, 2024 |title=Shaboozey Biography & Net Worth |url=https://naijapickup.com/music/artistes/shaboozey/ |access-date=July 14, 2024 |work=Np Xmedia}} He was signed to [[Republic Records]] in 2017 after catching their attention with singles "Starfoxx" and "Robert Plant", and released his debut studio album, ''Lady Wrangler'', the following year. His second studio album, ''Cowboys Live Forever'', ''Outlaws Never Die'', was released in October 2022 through [[Empire Distribution]].{{Cite press release|url=https://shorefire.com/releases/entry/shaboozeys-bold-genre-melding-statement-lp-cowboys-live-forever-outlaws-never-die|title=Shaboozey's Bold, Genre-Melding Statement LP "Cowboys Live Forever, Outlaws Never Die"|date=October 7, 2022|author=[[Shore Fire Media]]|access-date=April 2, 2024}} His third studio album, ''[[Where I've Been, Isn't Where I'm Going]]'', was released on May 31, 2024, which he will promote with headlining shows in the US, as well as a slot as an [[opening act]] for [[Jessie Murph]] on tour. Though his earlier music had more of a [[trap music|trap]] influence, his later songs have more of a [[folk-pop]] sound with [[acoustic guitar]]. == Musical style and influences == His music combines [[hip hop music|hip hop]], [[country music|country]], [[rock music|rock]], and [[Americana music|Americana]].{{Cite web |last=McClay |first=Caché |date=March 29, 2024 |title=Beyoncé features Shaboozey twice on 'Cowboy Carter': Who is the hip-hop, country artist? |url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/entertainment/music/2024/03/29/beyonce-spaghettii-new-song-who-is-shaboozey-featured/73138223007 |access-date=April 2, 2024 |work=[[USA Today]]}} In an interview with [[ColorsxStudios]], Shaboozey cites [[the Rolling Stones]], [[Grateful Dead]], [[Bob Dylan]], and [[Led Zeppelin]] as influences, as well as [[Martin Scorsese]] films such as ''[[Taxi Driver]]''. Other influences include [[Fela Kuti]], [[Clipse]], [[Roger Waters]], [[Backstreet Boys]], [[Pharrell Williams]], [[Missy Elliott]], [[Lead Belly]], and [[Johnny Cash]]. == Discography == === Studio albums === {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |+ List of studio albums, with selected details, chart positions and certifications ! scope="col" rowspan="2" | Title ! scope="col" rowspan="2" | Album details ! scope="col" colspan="7" | Peak chart positions ! rowspan="2" |Certifications |- ! scope="col" style="width:2.8em;font-size:90%;"| [[Billboard 200|US]]
